review: I received this as a gift about a month ago.  I am giving it a 4 because I want it to do more.  I live in a rural community with poor internet.  I have 3MB (high speed internet).. I know,  ridiculous right!  I have been a prime user and netflix user for several years  I hooked up a mac to my TV so I could watch netflix, prime and youtube or search the web.  I setup the Fire TV in about 5 - 10 minutes, with out the manual and worked out of the box.  At first it locked up ALOT and I almost shut it off, but I was told to give it a chance, that it will download content and catch up.  And After a few ours it stopped locking up and runs perfect. It has not locked up since.  What is missing is that I want is to replace my PC connection.  I can't because the voice command will only search Amazon Library.  It will bring you to the other apps but  then you are on your own, to search the apps through there interface.  Some collaboration and cooperation between the services is needed. But now, for my web viewing,  I use my wireless keyboard and track pad and revert back to the Mac attached to my TV.  I want a single interface for my home entertainment. The web is part of that landscape.  The Amazon Fire TV is a great product, the price is good, the size is  discrete and the voice commands work.  It is very simple to use.  It is a good solution and cost effective if you are ready to drop Cable and convert to Prime.  Your Return on Investment can almost immediate.  So I would recommend it, but don't expect the voice recognition to go beyond prime.
